column4: 'lo. I just did an upgrade on linux [apt-get upgrade] and now all of a sudden grud fails to see my windows installation. On top of this, my xserver has crashed... I need to fix the windows problem first though....
Do you just need to put Windows back in your /boot/grub/menu.lst or what are you looking for?
Yeah. Basically. I'd like that. Like, when I installed it did that for me, so I'd rather have an automated program, than have to guess where the file is.
Well, I don't know of any GUIs for Grub (if you find a good one let me know), but I could give you the syntax to put in that menu.lst to get Windows going.
I would love that.. Thing is I have like 5 harddrives.. so I'm not in a guessing mood :D
No problem, first "sudo fdisk -l" and look for the Windows partition (ntfs).
I'll look in fstab.. I have it mounted just remembered lol..
You have to put sudo in front--did you do that?
That should be enough. Do you have an sdaX? In other words, is sdbX your second drive or something?
Yeah.. Second drive... First drive has a borked and old copy of windows installed, sdb1 has this linux os and the working windows OS
So Windows is on your second HD, on the first partition? Is that corrrect?
OK, just add the following in your /boot/grub/menu.lst and it should work, assuming your Windows is OK: http://pastebin.com/d3829ccf4
Soz, I can't open up graphical stuff [xserver is broken]
To clarify, I'm also behind a university firewall with a random ISA proxy, so I can't even use lynx / links :(
